VLIB_integralImage16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_integralImage16 (const uint16_t pIn[restrict], uint16_t inCols, uint16_t inRows, uint32_t pLastLine[restrict], uint32_t pOut[restrict])

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_integralImage16 ( const uint16_t  pIn[restrict],
uint16_t  inCols,
uint16_t  inRows,
uint32_t  pLastLine[restrict],
uint32_t  pOut[restrict] 
)

Description
This function calculates the Integral image of an 16-bit image.
Parameters:
[in] *pIn 16-bit input image (UQ16.0)
[in] inCols Width of input image (in pixels) (UQ16.0)
[in] inRows Height of input image (in pixels) (UQ16.0)
[in,out] *pLastLine 32-bit carry-over buffer (UQ32.0)
[out] *pOut 32-bit output data (UQ32.0)
Assumptions
  • inCols must be a multiple of 4 pixels.
  • The arguments pIn, pOut, and pLastLine must be 64-bit aligned.
  • pIn is a pointer to an (inCols x inRows) array of 16-bit data.
  • pOut is a pointer to an (inCols x inRows) array of 32-bit data.
  • pLastLine is a pointer to an (inCols x 1) array of 32-bit data.
  • The data pointed to by pLastLine needs to be initialized to 0s before first call on an image. This buffer is intended to be used as a carry-over state buffer beteen subsequent calls on the same image.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
